article_text:
SANTIAGO, Chile—Socialist Michelle Bachelet swept to victory in Sunday's presidential elections, winning a second term to pursue her agenda of spreading the benefits of an economic boom more broadly.

Ms. Bachelet, who governed Chile as the country's first female president from 2006 to 2010, captured 62% of the vote in the runoff election against center-right candidate Evelyn Matthei.

Former labor minister Ms. Matthei received...

twitter.description: Socialist Michelle Bachelet swept to victory in Sunday's presidential elections for a second term that will allow her to pursue an agenda of widening the government's role in one of South America's most prosperous countries.
twitter.title: Socialist Bachelet Wins Chilean Presidency

image.alt: Socialist Michelle Bachelet wins Chilean presidency
